title: Directs the executive chamber to establish an internet webpage on the governor's website providing information on and applications for state grants
summary: Directs the executive chamber to establish an internet webpage on the governor's website providing information on and applications for state grants; such webpage shall be known as "NewYorkgrants.gov".
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2828

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. COLTON, PHEFFER, JAFFEE, WEISENBERG, BENEDETTO,
         GUNTHER, GALEF, ZEBROWSKI, SPANO,  CASTRO,  MENG,  KAVANAGH,  MILLMAN,
         BARRON,  J. RIVERA,  SAYWARD,  McDONOUGH, BARCLAY, MURRAY, MOLINARO --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of  A.  ABBATE,  AMEDORE,  BRENNAN,  BURLING,
         CRESPO, FINCH, GIGLIO, GOTTFRIED, MAISEL, MAYERSOHN, McENENY, MONTESA-
         NO, PEOPLES-STOKES, RAIA, REILLY, SALADINO, SCHROEDER, SWEENEY, THIELE
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Governmental Operations

       AN  ACT  to amend the executive law, in relation to establishing a state
         internet webpage which provides information on all grants provided  by
         the state

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new section  164-e
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 164-E. STATE GRANT WEBSITE. 1. DEFINITIONS. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS
    4  SECTION:
    5    (A)  "APPLICANT"  SHALL  MEAN ANY INDIVIDUAL, PROPRIETORSHIP, PARTNER-
    6  SHIP, ASSOCIATION, COOPERATIVE, LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY,  CORPORATION,
    7  NOT-FOR-PROFIT  CORPORATION,  STATE OR LOCAL AGENCY, OR ANY OTHER ENTITY
    8  THAT MAY BE INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR A GRANT.
    9    (B) "GRANT" SHALL MEAN FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY A STATE AGENCY
   10  TO CARRY OUT A PUBLIC PURPOSE. HOWEVER,  SUCH  TERM  SHALL  NOT  INCLUDE
   11  PERSONAL  FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE USED TO BENEFIT AN INDIVIDUAL OR INDIVID-
   12  UALS.
   13    (C) "STATE AGENCY" SHALL MEAN ANY DEPARTMENT, BOARD,  BUREAU,  COMMIS-
   14  SION,  DIVISION,  OFFICE, COUNCIL OR AGENCY OF THE STATE, PUBLIC BENEFIT
   15  CORPORATION OR  PUBLIC  AUTHORITY  AT  LEAST  ONE  MEMBER  OF  WHICH  IS
   16  APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK.
   17    2.  THE EXECUTIVE CHAMBER SHALL ESTABLISH, POST AND MAINTAIN AN INTER-
   18  NET WEBPAGE ON THE STATE WEBSITE MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF THE  GOVER-
   19  NOR,  TO  BE  KNOWN  AS "NEWYORKGRANTS.GOV". SUCH INTERNET WEBPAGE SHALL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07418-01-1

       A. 2828                             2

    1  PROVIDE ACCESS TO AND INFORMATION ON ALL GRANTS OFFERED BY  STATE  AGEN-
    2  CIES.  SUCH INFORMATION INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, APPLICATION FORMS
    3  FOR  GRANTS  IF  AVAILABLE ON THE INTERNET, SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE IN A
    4  TIMELY  MANNER,  TO  THE MAXIMUM EXTENT POSSIBLE, SO THAT APPLICANTS MAY
    5  APPLY FOR SUCH GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE. THE WEBPAGE  ESTABLISHED  PURSUANT
    6  TO  THIS  SUBDIVISION MAY PROVIDE LINKS TO SIMILAR FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL
    7  AND OTHER INTERNET WEBSITES OFFERING GRANTS,  AND  LINKS  TO  GOVERNMENT
    8  PERSONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, SUCH AS BENEFITS AND LOANS.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to establishing a state internet webpage which provides information on all grants provided by the state
